jobs.title: IoT DevOps - Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

StrikeWeb is the strategic operations platform behind a fleet of autonomous robotic agents. As a Senior IoT DevOps Engineer, you’ll take ownership of the infrastructure, tooling, and systems that make scalable, reliable, and secure deployment of robotics possible. This is a critical leadership role bridging DevOps best practices with the high-stakes operational requirements of real-world autonomy.

In this role you will get to

  • Lead the design and implementation of resilient DevOps architectures for remote fleet management, including over-the-air software and firmware updates.

  • Architect and maintain secure CI/CD pipelines to support rapid iteration while meeting safety and compliance requirements across heterogeneous device types.

  • Build sophisticated telemetry, logging, and alerting systems to detect and resolve issues across the StrikeWeb application and its deployed agents.

  • Champion automation in deployment, monitoring, incident response, and rollback strategies across production and field environments.

  • Collaborate across robotics, infrastructure, and cloud teams to deliver high-assurance operations for mission-critical deployments.

  • Mentor junior engineers and contribute to shaping technical direction, engineering standards, and cross-functional DevOps culture.

  • Drive root cause analysis and long-term improvements from field incidents, reliability reviews, and postmortems.

Must have experience

  • 5+ years in a DevOps, SRE, or Infrastructure role with demonstrable impact in high-availability or mission-critical systems, ideally involving IoT or edge deployments.

  • Expertise with containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration frameworks (e.g., Kubernetes, Nomad) at scale.

  • Deep experience with CI/CD systems (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, ArgoCD) and Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).

  • Proficient in at least one systems-oriented programming language such as Go, Python, or Rust.

  • Strong command of cloud-native architectures (AWS, GCP, or Azure), including identity, networking, and observability.

  • Fluency with metrics, tracing, and log-based observability platforms (e.g., Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, ELK, Grafana).

  • Comfort with edge-native communication protocols (e.g., MQTT, gRPC, ZeroMQ) and hybrid cloud-edge topologies.

  • Experience with secure bootstrapping, provisioning, and fleet authentication mechanisms.

Nice to have experience

  • Track record managing large-scale over-the-air update systems for IoT or embedded environments.

  • Familiarity with robotics systems, hardware-software integration, or real-time telemetry loops.

  • Involvement in cross-team initiatives, such as DevSecOps, incident response drills, or operational runbooks.

  • Contributions to open-source infrastructure or IoT tooling projects.

About Delian

We live under a new world order. To protect Europe and its allies we're building a new defense prime. One tailored for the era of autonomous warfare.

While building for the future, our culture emulates the defense industry's roots: mass scale; operational excellence; execution speed; rapid technology adoption.

To strive for this we combine expertise in autonomy, electronic warfare and rapid manufacturing. Paired with young, passionate and mission driven engineering and technical talent.

We have offices in Athens & London.

jobs.title: Autonomy (Planning and Control) - Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

We’re seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our Autonomy team and contribute to the planning and control subsystems. In this role, you will design and implement core algorithms and infrastructure that allow autonomous systems to plan trajectories, react to complex environments, and execute smooth, precise motion under real-world constraints.

If you're passionate about turning sensor data into actionable behavior, and want to push the frontier of autonomy in challenging domains, we’d love to hear from you.

In this role, you will get to

  • Design and implement motion planning algorithms (e.g., trajectory generation, optimization-based planning, behavior trees) for autonomous decision-making in dynamic environments.

  • Develop control systems for trajectory tracking, stability, and constraint handling across a wide range of operating conditions.

  • Collaborate with perception, prediction, localization, and hardware teams to ensure planning and control pipelines are tightly integrated and robust to edge cases.

  • Build simulation tools and test infrastructure to validate planning and control algorithms across a variety of scenarios.

  • Analyze real-world performance and iterate on algorithms for safety, efficiency, and smoothness under uncertainty.

Must have experience

  • Strong proficiency in C++ and Python, with a track record of shipping high-performance code in robotics or real-time systems.

  • Deep understanding of motion planning and control theory, including trajectory generation, kinematics/dynamics modeling, and optimization.

  • Experience developing real-time planners (e.g., RRT, A*, MPC, spline-based planners) or controllers (e.g., PID, LQR, MPC) for physical systems.

  • Familiarity with constraints such as latency, computational cost, vehicle dynamics, and safety-critical decision making.

  • Proven ability to debug complex, system-level interactions between planning, control, and the real world.

  • Strong collaboration skills and experience working cross-functionally with perception, systems, and hardware teams.

Nice to have experience

  • Experience with ROS/ROS2 and integration of planning/control components into a broader autonomy framework.

  • Familiarity with nonholonomic systems, differential constraints, and actuation limits in practice.

  • Knowledge of probabilistic planning, uncertainty-aware control, or learning-based planning methods.

  • Exposure to simulation frameworks and real-time validation in hardware-in-the-loop environments.

  • Contributions to open-source planning or control libraries in robotics or autonomous vehicles.

About Delian

While building for the future, our culture emulates the defense industry's roots: mass scale; operational excellence; execution speed; rapid technology adoption.

To strive for this we combine expertise in autonomy, electronic warfare and rapid manufacturing. Paired with young, passionate and mission driven engineering and technical talent.

We have offices in Athens & London.

jobs.title: Frontend - Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

StrikeWeb is Delian’s high-performance autonomy control platform, enabling real-time coordination and supervision of robotic agents deployed in dynamic, real-world settings. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will lead the development of intuitive, responsive, and reliable user interfaces that serve as the operational nerve center for autonomous systems. Your work will directly empower engineers and field operators to interact with complex robotics infrastructure through clear, real-time visualization and control interfaces.

In this role you will get to

  • Architect and build high-performance, real-time frontend components for robotics command and telemetry interfaces.

  • Lead design and implementation of UX systems that deliver clarity and responsiveness under mission-critical workloads.

  • Collaborate closely with robotics, cloud, and DevOps teams to integrate telemetry, control signals, and diagnostics into intuitive web-based workflows.

  • Engage end users to gather actionable feedback, perform usability testing, and iterate quickly on interface improvements.

  • Drive frontend quality through code reviews, performance profiling, and design standardization across StrikeWeb.

Must have experience

  • 5+ years of professional experience building production-grade frontend applications with JavaScript, TypeScript, and React.

  • Demonstrated ownership of UI/UX systems in fast-paced or technically demanding environments.

  • Strong understanding of asynchronous web communication and real-time data flow (e.g., WebSockets, WebRTC, streaming APIs).

  • Deep experience debugging and optimizing frontend performance across modern browsers and platforms.

  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with a user-first engineering mindset.

  • Proficiency in WebRTC, video streaming, or telemetry data rendering in web environments.

  • Experience developing and maintaining internal design systems or component libraries.

Nice to have experience

  • Experience designing real-time dashboards, mission control interfaces, or robotics tooling.

  • Familiarity with 3D graphics or geospatial visualization (e.g., Three.js, deck.gl, Mapbox, Cesium).

  • Exposure to frontend architecture for highly dynamic and event-driven systems.

jobs.title: Autonomy (Target Tracking) - Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

We’re hiring a Senior Software Engineer to lead development of our target tracking subsystem — a foundational component of our autonomy stack that fuses sensor data into coherent, actionable estimates of dynamic tracks in the world. You will design and implement tracking algorithms that operate reliably in complex, uncertain, and adversarial environments.

If you're excited about turning noisy, asynchronous sensor inputs into high-confidence world models for planning and decision-making, this role is for you.

In this role, you will get to

  • Architect and implement real-time tracking pipelines that fuse data from radar, cameras, and IMUs to track dynamic objects.

  • Design and optimize multi-target tracking algorithms (e.g., Kalman filters, JPDA, MHT, PHD filters, or learning-based trackers).

  • Collaborate with perception and planning teams to ensure accurate, low-latency estimates of object position, velocity, identity, and intent.

  • Evaluate performance across synthetic and real-world datasets, and improve tracking robustness under occlusion, clutter, and degraded sensing.

  • Build tools for debugging, visualization, introspection, and benchmarking of tracking systems in both simulation and live deployments.

Must have experience

  • Strong programming skills in C++ and Python, with a focus on performance and reliability in real-time systems.

  • Deep understanding of state estimation, Bayesian filtering, and multi-sensor data fusion techniques.

  • Experience with tracking algorithms such as extended/unscented Kalman filters, particle filters, or multi-hypothesis tracking.

  • Background in robotics, autonomous systems, or embedded sensor platforms, with demonstrated success in deployed applications.

  • Strong debugging and systems-level reasoning skills, especially under conditions of sensor dropout, noise, or ambiguous association.

  • Experience with real-world data collection, analysis, and iterative model improvement.

  • Exposure to open-world tracking challenges, such as birth/death modeling, ID switches, or false positives.

Nice to have experience

  • Familiarity with object detection and classification pipelines, and integrating perception outputs into trackers.

  • Experience with sensor synchronization and timestamp alignment across distributed systems.

  • Knowledge of deep learning-based tracking or trajectory prediction approaches for dynamic agents.

  • Experience with ROS/ROS2, and integrating tracking modules within autonomy frameworks.

jobs.title: Backend (Product) - Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

StrikeWeb is Delian’s real-time command and control platform for autonomous systems, delivering operational insight and coordination across a fleet of robotics agents in critical national security and defense applications. As a Senior Backend Engineer, you’ll design and build the robust and scalable infrastructure that enables high-throughput data processing, real-time decision pipelines, and seamless integration across sensors and actuators.

This is a mission-driven engineering role ideal for backend developers who are motivated by building scalable, reliable and impactful production-critical systems.

In this role you will get to

  • Design and develop scalable backend services that integrate and process real-time sensor data across distributed systems.

  • Build core infrastructure and deployment pipelines to support continuous delivery of StrikeWeb capabilities to production.

  • Develop testing frameworks for validating backend logic in both software-only and hardware-in-the-loop environments.

  • Benchmark application performance under load and drive systemic optimizations in latency, throughput, and resiliency.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with frontend, robotics, DevOps, and product teams to deliver end-to-end capabilities from concept to field deployment.

What previous experience would make you successful in this job

(In our view, but feel free to prove us wrong!)

  • A degree in engineering or similar field.

  • A track record of building, deploying and maintaining software driven solutions to actual users.

  • 5+ years of backend development experience, including building and deploying production-grade scalable services.

  • Strong understanding of distributed systems, networking fundamentals, and real-time or near-real-time application architectures.

  • Proficiency in one or more backend programming languages such as Python, Go, Rust, Java, or C++ and deep understanding of their respective ecosystems.

  • Experience with API design for control systems and event-driven architectures (e.g., gRPC, Kafka, MQTT).

  • Experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and cloud-native services for compute, storage, and messaging.

  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and modern build/deployment toolchains (e.g., GitHub Actions, Docker, Terraform).

  • Experience integrating with and/or building telemetry, monitoring, and alerting stacks (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, OpenTelemetry).

  • Experience with robotics systems, embedded software, or high-throughput sensor data processing.

  • Experience with high-performance networking, stream processing frameworks, and/or time-series databases.

  • Background in security-focused or defense-related backend systems with reliability and auditability requirements.

  • Contributions to open-source backend frameworks, infrastructure tools, and/or monitoring systems.

jobs.title: Aeronautical / UAV Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

As an Aeronautical / UAV Engineer at Delian, you'll play a central role in helping us build the products redefining warfare. From concept to production. This will primarily involve building fixed-wing UAVs, but also supporting our field operations.

If you spent your childhood building RC planes or drones, this role is perfect for you.

This role is open to candidates in both Athens & London.

In this role you'll get to:

  • Design, develop, and optimize fixed-wing UAV, from concept through prototype to production.

  • Perform aerodynamic analysis and optimization using CFD tools to improve lift, drag, and stability performance.

  • Develop detailed 3D models and engineering drawings using CAD software (SolidWorks or equivalent).

  • Integrate electrical circuits, avionics, sensors, and autopilot systems (ArduPilot/Pixhawk or equivalent).

  • Apply knowledge of additive (3D printing, composites) and subtractive (CNC machining, milling, lathing) manufacturing methods for prototyping and production.

  • Build, assemble, and test airframes and subsystems, ensuring airworthiness and performance against design goals.

  • Conduct flight testing and data analysis, troubleshooting aerodynamic or systems issues.

  • Drive the transition from prototype development to scalable production.

  • Maintain compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory standards for UAV development and operations.

  • Support field operations as a licensed UAV pilot with hands-on experience flying fixed-wing aircrafts.

Key requirements:

  • Past experience building UAVs or RC planes, for work or personal projects.

  • Know how to fly fixed-wing UAVs (and willing to get a license after joining us).

You'd ideally also have:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering or a related discipline.

  • Strong background in aerodynamics, propulsion, and flight mechanics.

  • Proficiency in CFD analysis and CAD modeling.

  • Understanding of electrical circuits, power systems, and avionics integration.

  • Hands-on experience with ArduPilot (tuning, mission planning, hardware integration).

  • Knowledge of manufacturing methods (composite fabrication, 3D printing, CNC machining).

  • Track record of building prototypes and advancing to production-ready designs.

Nice to have experience:

  • Experience in weight optimization, payload integration, and endurance improvement.

  • Exposure to defense, aerospace, or UAV regulatory environments.

  • Strong problem-solving, documentation, and teamwork skills.

ABOUT THE ROLE

As an Aeronautical / UAV Engineer at Delian, you'll play a central role in helping us build the products redefining warfare. From concept to production. This will primarily involve building fixed-wing UAVs, but also supporting our field operations.

If you spent your childhood building RC planes or drones, this role is perfect for you.

This role is open to candidates in both Athens & London.


IN THIS ROLE YOU'LL GET TO:

 - Design, develop, and optimize fixed-wing UAV, from concept through prototype to production.

 - Perform aerodynamic analysis and optimization using CFD tools to improve lift, drag, and stability performance.

 - Develop detailed 3D models and engineering drawings using CAD software (SolidWorks or equivalent).

 - Integrate electrical circuits, avionics, sensors, and autopilot systems (ArduPilot/Pixhawk or equivalent).

 - Apply knowledge of additive (3D printing, composites) and subtractive (CNC machining, milling, lathing) manufacturing methods for prototyping and production.

 - Build, assemble, and test airframes and subsystems, ensuring airworthiness and performance against design goals.

 - Conduct flight testing and data analysis, troubleshooting aerodynamic or systems issues.

 - Drive the transition from prototype development to scalable production.

 - Maintain compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory standards for UAV development and operations.

 - Support field operations as a licensed UAV pilot with hands-on experience flying fixed-wing aircrafts.


KEY REQUIREMENTS:

 - Past experience building UAVs or RC planes, for work or personal projects.

 - Know how to fly fixed-wing UAVs (and willing to get a license after joining us).


YOU'D IDEALLY ALSO HAVE:

 - Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering or a related discipline.

 - Strong background in aerodynamics, propulsion, and flight mechanics.

 - Proficiency in CFD analysis and CAD modeling.

 - Understanding of electrical circuits, power systems, and avionics integration.

 - Hands-on experience with ArduPilot (tuning, mission planning, hardware integration).

 - Knowledge of manufacturing methods (composite fabrication, 3D printing, CNC machining).

 - Track record of building prototypes and advancing to production-ready designs.


NICE TO HAVE EXPERIENCE:

 - Experience in weight optimization, payload integration, and endurance improvement.

 - Exposure to defense, aerospace, or UAV regulatory environments.

 - Strong problem-solving, documentation, and teamwork skills.


ABOUT DELIAN

We live under a new world order. To protect Europe and its allies we're building a new defense prime https://delian.ai/blog/manifesto. One tailored for the era of autonomous warfare.

While building for the future, our culture emulates the defense industry's roots: mass scale; operational excellence; execution speed; rapid technology adoption.

To strive for this we combine expertise in autonomy, electronic warfare and rapid manufacturing. Paired with young, passionate and mission driven engineering and technical talent.

We have offices in Athens & London.
